Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

Hi EM maintainers, I am using json5 python module for adding C-style comment support, but the CI is failing due to json5 is not python native module. I am not sure how to add json5 module support, are there any example for adding new python module? Thank you.

This is going to impose a new dependency on all developers building locally, whereas previously we only used stock python.  This is also why your build failed.

Is there any way to accomplish this without using a json5 dependency?

I also worry a little that json5 is different than nlohmann::json with comments.  Aren't they following different specifications?
Hi Ed, I found some examples that use regex to capture c comments and remove it. Please have a look with patchset 4, thank you.
Done
Doesn't this mean it is going to drop any comments on files if people run this script?  Then the code-format tool will fail because there will be modifications, right?

The json load doesn't support the comments so I have to strip the comments first before loading.
Is there any suggest way for this problem?
We would have to do something to capture the comments and then inject them back into the output.
Done

Hi Patrick, sorry, I didn't notice your comment when I send this change.
Could you help review if it is ok to have a single-line comment in a new line? If no, I will revert the change.
It is fine but please update comments.
Done
It would be nice to document these in one of the markdown docs in the repo.
Done

Since this script sorts Exposes records, this implies that there can't be comments in those records, right?  Can you also list that here.

In fact, I think most of this header would also be good to put in the markdown documentation.
Done
Thanks!
formatting in the markdown seems to have failed. we might need "json5" as the code-type?
Any test done? Please add here

Testd on harma system with manual applied a patch.
Commit message updated.
Thanks for the patch, this is a great feature! It might be helpful to add an example comment in one of the existing configuration or schema to demonstrate the support.
When are the comments removed and when are the comments inserted back. Please clarify
Done
Is comments in schema supported? Please add in commit message to make it clear.

Thanks for the notice.
Because this patch only intend to add C-style comment support on configuration JSON file, I rollback the changes on schema file loading.
Doesn't that cause files with C-style comments to fail to verify now?

There are two places of JSON file loading in validate_configs.py, one is for schema files, another one is for config files.
Do we need C-style comments support for schema files too?
Got it.  I guess not.
